sub_title: Junior Lecturer/PhD Researcher at Radboud University, the Netherlands
summary:
Hanif Widyanto is a junior lecturer/Ph.D. researcher at Radboud University Nijmegen, the Netherlands, and at President University Business School, Bekasi, Indonesia. His research mainly investigates open innovation, ideation contest, digital marketing, adoption of innovation, fintech, entrepreneurship, and access to funding for small businesses. Since 2018, he has secured research grants totaling more than IDR 1 billion (~USD70,000). Prior to working as a lecturer and researcher, he has spent nearly a decade working in various positions in the public, private, and not-for-profit sectors. He earned his B.Sc. from President University and M.Sc. from the University of Indonesia (UI) with cum laude honours.

Research interests: Ideation contest, open innovation, FinTech, mobile payment, digital marketing, entrepreneurial intention, e-commerce

education.field_of_study: Faculty of Economics, Major in Management, Specialization in International Business

publications.name: Safety first: extending UTAUT to better predict mobile payment adoption by incorporating perceived security, perceived risk and trust

authors.headline: Junior Lecturer/PhD Researcher at Radboud University, the Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
- Giving tutorials/lectures in the Bachelor's degree programmes offered by the Department of Business Administration, and in the Master's programmes of Marketing and/or Innovation and Entrepreneurship at the Nijmegen School of Management (NSM)
- Supervising Master's thesis students at NSM
- Conducting Ph.D. in Marketing and Responsible Innovation, with a thesis topic concerning "Democratising innovation: Responsibly engaging diverse stakeholders in innovation ideation contest" under the supervision of Prof. Bas Hillebrand, Dr. Vera Blazevic, and Dr. Paul Driessen
profile_positions.title: Junior Lecturer/PhD Researcher

profile_positions.description:
- Full-time lecturer, teaching digital marketing, entrepreneurship, and digital literacy courses
- Research on fintech, consumer behaviour, digital marketing, access to funding for small businesses, venture capital, and entrepreneurship in emerging markets
- Received various research grants totalling more than USD 70,000
- Published 19 journals/proceedings/book chapters with 3 Scopus-indexed publications between 2018-2021
profile_positions.title: University Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
- Managed the university's international partnerships office
- Doubled the number of international partners with esteemed universities around the world
- Opened up various global exchange and internship opportunities for students
- Jointly secured Erasmus+ grant worth EUR 998,332 for the "Growing Indonesia: a Triangular Approach" project
profile_positions.title: Director of International Partnerships Office

profile_positions.description:
- Raising the awareness of and providing inspiration for entrepreneurship and innovation in Indonesia
- Design the program plan, strategy, and required resources according to program overarching guidelines and objectives 
- Manage resources and operations in executing program plan and ensure timely and high-quality output 
- Provide input on the suitable future programs based on the impact of the program in serving our mission 
- Reach to and engage various entrepreneurship stakeholders to propagate our mission through media, events, word-of-mouth, and of course through our programs 
- Project managed: Social Innovation Camp JKT, CGI Bootcamp, CGI in-house entrepreneurs
profile_positions.title: Senior Program Officer
Business Development Officer

volunteer_experiences.role: Co-Founder; Current role: Communication and Partnership
volunteer_experiences.description: The International Indonesian Scholars Association (I-4) is the largest government-supported diaspora organisation dedicated to bridge overseas Indonesian scholars/scientists with their local counterparts. I co-founded the organisation in 2009 with my colleagues from PPI Dunia (OISAA). To date, I have held various positions to support the organisation, from Treasury, Media, Membership database, and Partnerships.
